fieldInfos.label: Estimated intersection density of walkable roads

layer.name: Estimated intersection density of walkable roads per km2
layer.eaDescription: This EnviroAtlas dataset estimates the intersection density of walkable roads within a 750 meter radius of any given 10 meter pixel in the community. Intersections are defined as any point where 3 or more roads meet and density is calculated using kernel density, where closer intersections are weighted higher than further intersections. Intersection density is highly correlated with walking for transportation.

layer.name: Number of day care centers
layer.eaDescription: This map shows the number of day care centers in each census block group.

layer.name: Number of schools (K-12)
layer.eaDescription: This map shows the number of K-12 schools in each census block group.

layer.name: Dasymetric allocation of population
layer.eaDescription: This dasymetric population map intelligently reallocates 2010 population from census blocks to 30 meter pixels based on land cover and slope. It is used for metrics that require population to be spatially allocated at a pixel level, primarily in the urban section of the atlas.

layer.name: Employment diversity
layer.eaDescription: This map portrays a measure of employment diversity within each census block group. Job counts used in the equation are from eight employment categories: retail, office, service, industrial, entertainment, education, healthcare, and public administration.

popup.title: Block Group ID: {GEOID10}
popup.description: {expression/expr0}

layer.name: Employment Rate (percent)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of the population aged 16-64 who have worked in the past 12 months by block group. It includes people who worked any number of hours per week.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

layer.name: Employment:housing ratio
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the jobs-to-housing balance (or total employment divided by total occupied housing units) within each census block group for 2010.

layer.name: Jobs within a 45-minute drive, weighted
layer.eaDescription: This map indicates the relative accessibility to jobs from residences via automobile (in terms of street network travel time) for each census block group, compared to other block groups in the same metropolitan region. Jobs in nearby block groups (based on travel time) are weighted more heavily than those further away.

layer.name: Number of high-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning more than $3333 per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of households
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of households (i.e., occupied housing units) within each census block group in 2010. A household consists of all people who occupy a housing unit regardless of relationship. See user guide for details: https:

fieldInfos.label: Number of households with zero vehicles

layer.name: Number of households with zero vehicles
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of households without vehicles within each census block group in 2010. The word vehicle refers to private motor vehicles such as cars and trucks.

layer.name: Number of low-wage workers [home location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning $1250 or less per month summarized by residence within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of low-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning $1250 or less per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of middle-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the number of workers earning between $1250 and $3333 per month summarized by workplace location within each census block group.

layer.name: Number of workers [home location]
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the total number of workers by home location in 2010 within each census block group.

layer.name: Pedestrian-oriented street intersection density (intersections per square mile)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the degree of pedestrian-oriented street connectivity for each census block group, measured as street intersections per square mile. Intersections that exclude pedestrian passage were not counted.

layer.name: Percent Housing Units Built Before 1950
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of housing units built before 1950 by census tract. The values were calculated using data extracted from American Community Survey tables (2006- 2010).

fieldInfos.label: Percent of households with zero vehicles

layer.name: Percent of households with zero vehicles
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates zero-vehicle households as a percentage of all households within each census block group in 2010. The word vehicle refers to private motor vehicles such as cars and trucks.

layer.name: Percent low-wage workers [work location]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percentage of all workers within each census block group earning $1250 or less per month based on their workplace location.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who bike or walk to work

layer.name: Percent of workers who bike or walk to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who bike or walk to work.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who carpool to work

layer.name: Percent of workers who carpool to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who carpool to work.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation

layer.name: Percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who commute to work by public transportation.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who drive to work alone

layer.name: Percent of workers who drive to work alone
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who drive to work alone.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers who work from home

layer.name: Percent of workers who work from home
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers who work from home.  The data are based on the American Community Survey 5-year data for 2008-2012.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with 30 - 60 minutes travel time to work

layer.name: Percent of workers with 30 - 60 minutes travel time to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with travel time to work ranging from 30 to 60 minutes.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with 60 - 90 minutes travel time to work

layer.name: Percent of workers with 60 - 90 minutes travel time to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with travel time to work ranging from 60 to 90 minutes.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with greater than 90 minutes travel time to work

layer.name: Percent of workers with greater than 90 minutes travel time to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with more than 90 minutes travel time to work.

fieldInfos.label: Percent of workers with less than 30 minutes travel time to work

layer.name: Percent of workers with less than 30 minutes travel time to work
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the percent of workers within each block group with less than 30 minutes travel time to work.

layer.name: Residential density (hu/ac)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates residential density (or housing units per acre) within each census block group. Developed acreage is calculated by excluding parks, water bodies, conservation easements, and other protected areas.

layer.name: Total employment
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the total number of jobs in 2010 within each census block group.

layer.name: Total housing units
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates the number of housing units (both occupied and vacant) within each census block group in 2010. A housing unit is any living quarters, such as a house, apartment, or mobile home.

fieldInfos.label: Transit service per hour during evening peak

layer.name: Transit service per hour during evening peak
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the aggregate frequency of public transit service (trips per hour) in each census block group. Frequency reflects service during weekday afternoon peak commute period (4:00–7:00 pm).

layer.name: Workers per job  - Equilibrium Index
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates an index that measures the balance between workers and jobs within each census block group. An index value close to one indicates a balance between resident workers and jobs.

fieldInfos.label: Working age population within a 45-minute drive, weighted

layer.name: Working age population within a 45-minute drive, weighted
layer.eaDescription: This map indicates the relative accessibility to working age populations (residences) from employment locations via auto commute (in terms of street-network travel time) for each census block group. People living in nearby block groups (based on travel time) are weighted more heavily than those further away.

layer.name: Employment density (jobs/ac)
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates employment density (or jobs per acre) within each census block group. Developed acreage is calculated by excluding parks, water bodies, conservation easements, and other protected areas.

layer.name: Business address vacancy rate for 2014
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the percentage of business addresses that had remained vacant for more than one year in 2014. This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data.

fieldInfos.label: Change in business vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

layer.name: Change in business vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the change in the business vacancy rate from 2010-2014 in percentage points (2014 rate minus 2010 rate). This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data. Vacant buildings are included if they remained vacant for more than one year.

layer.name: Residential address vacancy rate for 2014
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the percentage of residential addresses that had remained vacant for more than one year in 2014. This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data.

fieldInfos.label: Change in residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points

layer.name: Change in residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014, in percentage points
layer.eaDescription: This map displays the change in the residential vacancy rate from 2010-2014 in percentage points (2014 rate minus 2010 rate). This layer is based on the United States Postal Service (USPS) Vacant Address Data. Vacant buildings are included if they remained vacant for more than one year.

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line and below $75,000

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line and below $75,000
layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above twice the poverty line ($30,000) and below $75,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012).

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000
layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above $75,000 and below $200,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012)

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000.

layer.name: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000.
layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households with incomes above $200,000 in the past 12 months (2008-2012)

fieldInfos.label: Percentage of households below the quality of life threshold income

layer.name: Percentage of households below the quality of life threshold income
layer.eaDescription: Percentage of households below the adjusted quality of life threshold income for their county (2008-2012). The threshold is the average optimal household income for quality of life, adjusted to reflect county cost of living.

fieldInfos.label: Threshold income for quality of life

layer.name: Threshold income for quality of life (Household $ per year)
layer.eaDescription: Threshold income for quality of life (household), based on national value adjusted to reflect county cost of living (2008-2012).

layer.name: Population [12-digit HUC]
layer.eaDescription: This map estimates the total population that lives in each 12-digit HUC for 2010.

layer.name: Brownfield Grantee (ACRES)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Brownfields: Shows only points from the Assessment, Cleanup and Redevelopment Exchange System (ACRES) grantee reported data on environmental activities and accomplishments (assessment, cleanup and redevelopment), funding, job training, and details on cooperative partners and leveraging efforts - a central objective of the Brownfields Program.

layer.name: Integrated Compliance Information System-Air (ICIS-Air)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Integrated Compliance Information System-Air Major (ICIS-Air Major)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Air Quality System (AIRS AQS)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Air Pollution: The air pollution data (ICIS-AIR, ICIS-AIR Major) contains compliance and permit data for stationary sources of air pollution (such as electric power plants, steel mills, factories, and universities) regulated by EPA, state and local air pollution agencies.

layer.name: Permitted Water Dischargers
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Water Dischargers: Includes permit information from the National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) which controls water pollution by regulating sources, such as municipal and industrial wastewater treatment facilities, that discharge pollutants into waters of the United States.

layer.name: Permitted Water Dischargers - Major
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Active
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Inactive
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Large Quantity Generators (LQG)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Transporters
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Hazardous Waste Sites (RCRA) - Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Hazardous Waste: Shows points from the RCRAINFO (Resource Conservation and Recovery Act Information) program (All points, Active sites, Inactive sites, Large Quantity Generators (LQG), Transporters, and Treaters, Storers, and Disposers (TSD)).

layer.name: Superfund
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Superfund (SEMS) and SEMS NPL: Includes the National Priorities List (NPL) among the known releases or threatened releases of hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants throughout the United States and its territories.

layer.name: Superfund - National Priorites List (NPL)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Superfund (SEMS) and SEMS NPL: Includes the National Priorities List (NPL) among the known releases or threatened releases of hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants throughout the United States and its territories.

layer.name: Toxic Release Inventory (TRI)
layer.eaDescription: This dataset includes data from facilities reporting to EPA - Toxic Releases: The Toxics Release Inventory (TRI) contains information on toxic chemical releases and waste management activities reported annually by certain industries as well as federal facilities.

layer.name: Number of farmers markets [12-digit HUC]
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the number of farmers markets within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2016.

fieldInfos.label: Number of farmers markets [census block group]

layer.name: Number of farmers markets [census block group]
layer.eaDescription: This map depicts the number of farmers markets within each census block group for 2016.

layer.name: EnviroAtlas Community Boundaries
layer.eaDescription: EnviroAtlas Communities and vicinities. The EnviroAtlas boundary for the each Community area was determined using the 2010 Census definition of an Urban Area.

layer.name: States, County, and Census Block Group boundaries
layer.eaDescription: Census boundaries for States, Counties, and Census Block Groups

layer.name: USEPA Regions
layer.eaDescription: US EPA Regions

layer.name: Congressional District boundaries and labels
layer.eaDescription: 114th Congressional District boundaries and labels

layer.name: Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC) Boundaries and labels
layer.eaDescription: NHDPlus V2 Hydrologic Unit Code boundaries and labels

layer.name: NHDPlus V2 features
layer.eaDescription: NHDPlus V2 features for waterbodies, areas, and flowlines. Flowlines are displayed based on Stream Order and Stream Order 1 features are not displayed in this service.

popup.title: NHDFlowline Main path - Stream Order 4 and higher: {GNIS_NAME}
NHDFlowline Main path - Stream Order 4 and higher: {GNIS_NAME}

layer.name: Landscape Conservation Cooperatives
layer.eaDescription: Landscape Conservation Cooperatives (LCCs) are represented in this map by 22 regions established across the U.S., Alaska, Hawaii, and U.S. territories. LCC groups are created through conservation and science partnerships between federal agencies, states, tribes, non-governmental organizations, universities, and private stakeholders.

layer.name: USEPA Ecoregions (Omernik)
layer.eaDescription: This map illustrates USEPA (Omernik) Level III and IV ecoregions, a geographic framework used for an ecosystem approach to land and water resource management. Ecoregions define relatively homogeneous geographical areas that contain similarities in the character of environmental resources.

layer.name: GAP Ecological Systems
layer.eaDescription: The GAP (Gap Anlaysis Program) Ecological Systems data layer, one of several data layers available in the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) GAP Land Cover Dataset, depicts native vegetation, agricultural areas, and urban development in 590 land use classes. Ecological Systems refers to the vegetation classification developed by NatureServe to map the natural vegetation of the U.S. Separate Ecological Systems datasets have been created for Alaska (LANDFIRE) and Hawaii (Hawaii Gap Analysis Project).

layer.name: Waterscape - Surface water
layer.eaDescription: Surface water identified in EnviroAtlas' hybrid National Land Cover Database-Cropland Data Layer or the NHDPlusV2 catseed grid. The land cover classes, 'Open Water', 'Woody Wetlands', and 'Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands' were considered surface water.

layer.name: Waterscape - Hydrologically connected zone
layer.eaDescription: Raster showing the hydrologically connected zone, defined as surface water plus any connected cells with high water acculmulation. This map uses a wetness index of 550 from a compound topographic index (CTI) to determine if the area is considered to be wet.

layer.name: Waterscape - Riparian zone
layer.eaDescription: Raster showing the riparian zone, defined as land within 108 meters of surface water identified in the NHDPlusV2 catseed grid or in EnviroAtlas' hybrid National Land Cover Database-Cropland Data Layer (including 'Open Water', 'Woody Wetlands', and 'Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands').

layer.name: Carbon sequestered by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps portray carbon removed annually from the atmosphere and sequestered in the above-ground biomass of trees in each census block group as Total (mt/yr) or Value ($/yr).

layer.name: Carbon stored by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps portray carbon stored in the above-ground biomass of trees by census block group as Total (mt/yr) or Value ($/yr).

layer.name: Cotton Crops
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict cotton (Yields, Hectares, Value) grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2007-2010.

layer.name: Fruit Crops
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict fruit crops (Yields, Hectares, Number) grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2010.

layer.name: Grain Crops
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict major grain crops (Yields, Hectares, Number, Value) grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2007-2010.

layer.name: Vegetable Crops
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict vegetable crops (Yields, Hectares, Number) grown annually within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2010.

layer.name: Residential population not within 500m of a park entrance
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the population (number of people or percent) that resides within 500 meters of a park entrance in each census block group.

layer.name: Residential population with minimal views of trees
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the population (number of people or percent) with less than 5 percent tree cover within 50 meters of their home.

layer.name: Residential population with  views of water
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the population (number of people or percent) in each census block group that may have a view of water within 50 meters of their home. These maps includes streams, lakes, rivers, and coastal waters.

layer.name: Residential population within 500m of a park entrance
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the population (number of people or percent) that resides within 500 meters of a park entrance in each census block group.

layer.name: Asthma exacerbation avoided due to nitrogen dioxide removed by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual asthma exacerbation cases that may be avoided due to total nitrogen dioxide removed by trees in each census block group as Total (cases/yr) or Value ($/yr).

layer.name: Asthma exacerbation avoided due to sulfur dioxide removed by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual asthma exacerbation cases that may be avoided due to total sulfur dioxide removed by trees in each census block group as Total (cases/yr) or Value ($/yr).

layer.name: School days not lost to illness due to ozone removed by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual school days that may not be lost to illness due to total ozone removed by trees in each census block group as Total (days/yr) or Value ($/yr).

layer.name: Percent impervious area in stream and lake buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the land covered by impervious surfaces within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters in each census block group. Impervious surfaces are materials that do not allow the penetration of water and include buildings, roads, and sidewalks.

layer.name: Percent land area in stream and lake buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent land in each census block group that is within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters.

layer.name: Percent tree cover in stream and lake buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent land covered by trees within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters in each census block group.

layer.name: Percent vegetated cover in stream and lake buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent land covered by vegetation within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters in each census block group.

layer.name: Total land area in stream and lake buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the square meters of land within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters in each census block group.

layer.name: Estimated tree cover in stream and lake buffer (percent)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent tree cover within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters. It is not summarized by census block group.

layer.name: Estimated vegetated cover in stream and lake buffer (percent)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent vegetated cover within (15 or 50) meters of hydrologically connected non-coastal waters. It is not summarized by census block group.

layer.name: Percent of stream and shoreline with &#119987  percent or more impervious cover within 30 meters
layer.eaDescription: Percentage of stream and water body shoreline lengths having impervious cover greater than or equal to 5% or 15% within 30 meters for 2011.

layer.name: Rare ecosystem forms
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent of land within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that could be classified as rare ecosystem forms or rare ecosystems forms protected for 2011. Ecosystem rarity in EnviroAtlas is based on size, shape, and type of ecosystem.

layer.name: Carbon monoxide removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the ambient carbon monoxide (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Nitrogen dioxide removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the nitrogen dioxide (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Ozone removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the ozone (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Particulate matter [PM10] removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the particulate matter greater than 2.5 microns but less than 10 microns (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Particulate matter [PM2.5] removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the particulate matter less than 2.5 microns (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Sulfur dioxide removed annually by tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the sulfur dioxide (total kilograms or mean percent) removed annually by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in biochemical oxygen demand [BOD5] due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in biochemical oxygen demand (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in chemical oxygen demand [COD] due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in chemical oxygen demand (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration from trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of copper due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of copper (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of nitrites and nitrates due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of nitrites and nitrates (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of soluble phosphorus due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of soluble phosphorus (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of total Kjeldahl nitrogen [TKN] due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of total Kjeldahl nitrogen (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of total phosphorus due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of total phosphorus (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Reduction in load of total suspended solids [TSS] due to tree cover (kg/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the (mean or median) reduction in load of total suspended solids (kg/yr) in streamflow due to filtration by trees in each census block group.

layer.name: Biological nitrogen fixation (kg N/ha/yr)
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the mean rate of biological nitrogen fixation from either the cultivation of crops or in natural and semi-natural ecosystems within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kg N/ha/yr for 2006.

layer.name: Annual oxidized nitrogen deposition (kg/ha)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual deposition of oxidized nitrogen within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kilograms per hectare for 2011. Wet deposition occurs when rain, snow, or fog carry nitrogen to the earth’s surface, dry deposition occurs when particles or gases attach to surfaces such as dust or smoke and fall to the earth's surface, and total includes both dry and wet deposition.

layer.name: Annual reduced nitrogen deposition (kg/ha)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual deposition of reduced nitrogen within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kilograms per hectare for 2011. Wet deposition occurs when rain, snow, or fog carry nitrogen to the earth’s surface, dry deposition occurs when particles or gases attach to surfaces such as dust or smoke and fall to the earth's surface, and total includes both dry and wet deposition.

layer.name: Annual sulfur deposition (kg/ha)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the annual deposition of sulfur within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in kilograms per hectare for 2011. Wet deposition occurs when rain, snow, or fog carry sulfur to the earth’s surface, dry deposition occurs when particles or gases attach to surfaces such as dust or smoke and fall to the earth's surface, and total includes both dry and wet deposition.

layer.name: Modeled Partners in Flight Watch List bird species
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict bird species richness for bird species listed by Partners in Flight in their Watch List for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Modeled State of the Birds species of conservation concern
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict bird species richness for Birds of Conservation Concern for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The Bird of Conservation Concern Normalized Index of Biodiversity (NIB) was calculated by dividing the mean species richness value of each HUC by the maximum value for the study area.

layer.name: Modeled threatened and endangered vertebrate species
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict threatened and endangered species richness for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Number of bird species vulnerable to range loss due to climate change by 2050
layer.eaDescription: These maps model Audubon Climate Endangered bird species (https://climate.audubon.org/) that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US   as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These are bird species vulnerable to a loss of 50% or more of current range due to climate change by 2050. These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Number of bird species vulnerable to range loss due to climate change by 2080
layer.eaDescription: These maps model Audubon Climate Threatened bird species (https://climate.audubon.org/) that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These are bird species vulnerable to a loss of 50% or more of current range due to climate change by 2080. These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Number of observed at-risk aquatic species
layer.eaDescription: These maps illustrates the number of observed species (Animal, Plant, Total) associated with aquatic habitat that are listed as G1, G2, or in the federal endangered species program that may reside within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011.

layer.name: Number of observed at-risk terrestrial species
layer.eaDescription: These maps illustrates the number of observed species (Animal, Plant, Total) associated with terrestrial habitat that are listed as G1, G2, or in the federal endangered species program that may reside within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011. G1 and G2 denote Global Conservation Ranks classified by NatureServe. Terrestrial habitat refers to land areas such as forests, grasslands, deserts and rainforests.

layer.name: Number of observed at-risk wetland species
layer.eaDescription: These maps illustrates the number of observed species (Animal, Plant, Total) associated with wetland habitat that are listed as G1, G2, or in the federal endangered species program that may reside within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011. G1 and G2 denote Global Conservation Ranks classified by NatureServe.

layer.name: Amphibian species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model amphibian species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Bird species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model bird species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Mammal species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model mammal species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Reptile species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model reptile species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Total vertebrate species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model vertebrate species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Big game species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model big game species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Fur bearer species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model fur bearer species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Small game species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model small game species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Total harvestable species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model harvestable species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Waterfowl species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model waterfowl species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Average reduction in ambient temperature (Celsius)
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the average reduction in the ambient temperature at 2pm on a hot summer day (daytime) or  at night following a hot summer day (nighttime) due to the cooling properties of tree cover in each census block group.

layer.name: Residential population within 300m of busy roadway
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the population (total or percent) within each census block group that resides within 300 meters of a busy roadway. A “busy” roadway in EnviroAtlas is defined to include interstates, arterial roads, and collector roads. It does not include local or neighborhood roads, though some of these roads may also experience consistent and heavy traffic.

layer.name: Residential population within 300m of busy roadway with &#119987 percent tree buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the total population within each census block group that resides within 300 meters of a busy roadway that is buffered by less than 25 percent or greater than 25 percent tree cover within 26 meters of a road edge. A “busy” roadway in EnviroAtlas is defined to include interstates, arterial roads, and collector roads. It does not include local or neighborhood roads, though some of these roads may also experience consistent and heavy traffic.

layer.name: Percent of busy roadway bordered by &#119987 percent tree buffer
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the percent of busy roadway in each census block group that  is bordered by less than 25 percent or greater than 25 percent tree cover within 26 meters of a road edge. A “busy” roadway in  EnviroAtlas is defined to include interstates, arterial roads, and collector roads. It does not include local or neighborhood roads, though some of these roads may also experience consistent and heavy traffic.

layer.name: Reduction in annual runoff due to tree cover
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the reduction in surface runoff as (m3/yr) or percent each year within each census block group due to the presence of trees.

layer.name: Mean rental rate per acre for farm land, 2008-2016
layer.eaDescription: These maps show mean rental rates for land on record by county, measured in $/acre for approximately 2008-2016, for irrigated farmland, non-irrigated farmland, or pastureland.

layer.name: Percent pasture on slopes
layer.eaDescription: These maps show the percentage of land area within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is classified as cropland on areas with slopes greater than or equal to three percent and nine percent.

layer.name: Percent cropland on slopes
layer.eaDescription: These maps show the percentage of land area within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) that is classified as pasture on areas with slopes greater than or equal to three percent and nine percent.

layer.name: Dissolved nutrients in surface runoff from agricultural fields (tons)
layer.eaDescription: These maps provide modeled estimates of the movement (flux) of nitrogen and phosphorus dissolved in surface runoff at the outer edges of all agricultural fields within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in metric tons of N or P for 2002. They include nitogen and phosphorus from fertilizer application and atmospheric deposition.

layer.name: Dissolved nutrients in tile drain subsurface flow from agricultural fields (tons)
layer.eaDescription: These maps provide modeled estimates of the movement (flux) of nitrogen and phosphorus dissolved in sub-surface (lateral) flow at the outer edges of tile-drained agricultural fields within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in metric tons of N or P for 2002. They include nitrogen and phosphorus from fertilizer application and atmospheric deposition.

layer.name: Nutrients attached to eroding surface soil from agricultural fields (tons)
layer.eaDescription: These maps provide modeled estimates of the movement (flux) of nitrogen and phosphorus attached to soil particles eroding from the surface of the agricultural fields within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in metric tons of N or P for 2002. They include nitrogen and phosphorus from fertilizer application and atmospheric deposition.

layer.name: Dissolved nutrients in leachate from agricultural fields (tons)
layer.eaDescription: These maps provide modeled estimates of nitrogen and phosphorus leachate, i.e., mass of nitrogen or phosphorus dissolved in percolate moving downward out of the soil layer underlying agricultural fields within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in metric tons of N or P for 2002. It does not necessarily reflect the amount of nitrogen or phosphorus that actually enters an underlying groundwater reservoir.

layer.name: Thermoelectric water use
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the millions of gallons of water consumed or withdrawn daily for thermoelectric power generation in each subwatershed (HUC-12) for 2016. Thermoelectric power creates electricity through steam powered turbines. This map is based on water withdrawn that is consumed without being returned to the watershed.

layer.name: Land area in 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the total land area in square meters or the percent in the 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Land area in 0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the total land area in in square meters or percent  in the  0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Impervious surface in 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the total impervious surface area in square meters or percent in the 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Impervious surface in 0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the total impervious surface area in square meters or percent in the 0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Population in 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the total or percent population living in the 1% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Population in 0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate the total or percent population living in the 0.2% Annual Chance Flood Hazard area in each census block group for 2017.

layer.name: Waterscape
layer.eaDescription: These maps identify surface water, the riparian zone surrounding surface water, and the hydrologically connected zone, which includes areas of high water accumulation connected to surface water.

layer.name: Roads Crossing Streams
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict the number and density of roads crossing streams in the subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011.

layer.name: Rare amphibian species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model rare amphibian species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Rare bird species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model rare bird species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). These maps are based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Summer bird species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict bird species richness during the summer for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Modeled G1, G2, G3 species
layer.eaDescription: These maps model the maximum number of NatureServe Globally Ranked Species (G1, G2, and G3) that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) . G1 species are critically imperiled, G2 species are imperiled, and G3 species are vulnerable. This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The maximum number does not represent the potential richness for the entire watershed.

layer.name: Modeled IUCN threatened terrestrial vertebrate species
layer.eaDescription: These maps model the maximum number of species listed as endangered by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC). This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The maximum number does not represent the potential richness for the entire watershed.

layer.name: Rare mammal species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model the maximum number of rare mammal species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US . Rare species were the 25% of mammal species with the smallest amount of predicted habitat. This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The maximum number does not represent the potential richness for the entire watershed.

layer.name: Modeled Partners in Amphibian and Reptile Conservation (PARC) species
layer.eaDescription: Thiese maps depict an index value of Partners in Amphibian and Reptile Conservation (PARC) species richness for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) . These species are listed as either threatened and endangered, G1-G3 or IUCN. G1 species are critically imperiled, G2 species are imperiled, and G3 species are vulnerable. This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The index value is based on average values determined for each HUC.

layer.name: Common bird species in steep decline
layer.eaDescription: These maps model the maximum number of species listed by Partners in Flight as common species in steep decline that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) . This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The maximum number does not represent the potential richness for the entire watershed.

layer.name: Rare reptile species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict an index value of rare reptile species richness for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US . Rare species were the 25% of reptile species with the smallest amount of predicted habitat. This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The index value is based on average values determined for each HUC.

layer.name: Rare vertebrate species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps model the maximum number of rare terrestrial vertebrate species that are likely to be present in any single location within a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US . Rare species were the 25% of vertebrate species with the smallest amount of predicted habitat. This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations. The maximum number does not represent the potential richness for the entire watershed.

layer.name: Winter bird species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps depict bird species richness during the winter for a subwatershed (12-digit HUC) in the Conterminous US  as the maximum, mean, or NIB (index). This map is based on habitat models, not wildlife observations.

layer.name: Total permitted discharges
layer.eaDescription: The total reported amount of permitted discharges within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC)  for 2011.

layer.name: Permitted metals discharges
layer.eaDescription: The total reported amount of permitted pollutant loadings for metals parameters within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011.

layer.name: Permitted priority pollutant discharges
layer.eaDescription: The total reported amount of permitted loadings for priority pollutants within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011.

layer.name: Permitted nitrogen discharges (pounds per year)
layer.eaDescription: The total reported amount of aggregated nitrogen discharges within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011, in pounds. This includes all parameters for total nitrogen, organic nitrogen, total Kjeldahl nitrogen, nitrite, nitrate, and ammonia. (Source: ICIS-NPDES)

layer.name: Permitted phosphorus discharges (pounds per year)
layer.eaDescription: The total reported amount of aggregated phosphorus discharges within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011, in pounds. All phosphorus and phosphate pollutant parameters are included. (Source: ICIS-NPDES)

layer.name: Permitted pathogen indicator discharges (colony-forming units / 100 ml)
layer.eaDescription: The reported discharge counts for total coliform, streptococci, E. coli, and enteric viruses in colony-forming units per 100 milliliters within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011. These parameters are reported in units that cannot be expressed as a mass discharge, and thus are not included as total load calculations. (Source: ICIS-NPDES)

layer.name: Wastewater flow discharges
layer.eaDescription: The reported flow of treated wastewater discharges from POTWS (publicly-owned treatment works) and non-POTWs within each subwatershed (12-digit HUC) for 2011. (Source: ICIS-NPDES)

layer.name: Non-native aquatic species richness
layer.eaDescription: These maps estimate species richness for non-native aquatic plants and animals for each subwatershed (12-digit HUC). They are based on observation data from multiple data sources.
